page.title: 02The River Lavant
page.content: The River Lavant starts at East Dean, runs through Charlton,Singleton,West Dean,Lavant,Fordwater and Chichester and on to Dell Quay.The river dries up around July,and it starts to flow again in November.The river flows about 20 miles.The River Lavant used to go around the Chichester city walls but no longer does so.We measured the depth of the river by the sewage station,and the depth was 18cm.Round about June you see mallards and moorhens hatch.You also see shell ducks and Canada Geese,which are usually found near Preston Farm,or Ox Barn.Most of the fish you see are red throats and sticklebacks,and also some Eels.There are newts which come up at night for earthworms and other insects .There are also tadpoles,waterboatmen, pondskaters,water beetles,water- shrimps,dragonflies & water rats.
